events.message: The customer submitted a claim after their car was involved in a rear-end collision at a traffic light.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident based on the details provided about the vehicle damage.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the auto accident claim for better customer assistance.
The customer received an acknowledgment confirming that the claim was successfully received and is under review.
The insurance company requested additional documents including police report and photos of the vehicle damage.
The claimant provided all the required documents including detailed images of the car damage and police report.
The insurance team began the investigation to evaluate the claim and verify the circumstances of the auto collision.
The investigation concluded confirming that the customer was not at fault in the rear-end accident claim.
The insurer proposed a settlement amount to cover the costs for repairs and related expenses of the damaged vehicle.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the prompt communication throughout the process.
The claim was approved officially by the claims department after all terms and conditions were verified.
Payment was processed and issued to the customerâ€™s account to cover the auto repairs as per the approved claim.
The insurance claim was officially closed following full payment and customer confirmation of repair completion.
